name: stacker
content:
stacker noun [C]
(PERSON/MACHINE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone whose job is putting goods or other things on shelves, or putting things on top of each other: The supermarket is recruiting checkout clerks and shelf stackers. I got a job as a crate stacker for a brewery. He worked as a stacker at the public library.
a machine for putting things on top of each other: Devices are fed from automatic tray stackers. All warehouse equipment (order pickers, stackers, lifting devices conveyors, fork lift trucks, etc.) must be fire resistant.

stacker noun [C]
(CONTAINER)
a set of containers that are designed to be put on top of each other: To keep nappies and other baby products out of the way, invest in one of these pretty stackers for the nursery.

stacker noun [C]
(TOY)
(also stacker toy) a child's toy in which similar items of different sizes must be put on top of each other : A stacker makes a great first "puzzle" for a baby or toddler. Toddlers will develop their motor skills and coordination with this bunny stacker toy.

stacker noun [C]
(FOOD)
a type of sandwich with several different types of food on top of each other: Their Italian deli-style stackers are the best in the city.
